text: My 4th favorite game ever. #1 is MGS4, then Soul Calibur 3, then Devil May Cry 1. The best thing about this game is the constant feeling of being rewarded. author: Rusa

text: Ahhh, the good days when we'd get regular handheld entries from this franchise. I'm still mad at Konami for dissolving Igarashi's team. It's no surprise there are so many Kickstarter and indie games using the Metroidvania formula, both the Metroid and Castlevania series are missing in action and most of us love that genre. You know what I'd like? A Paper Mario game using that formula, maybe like an evolution of Super Paper Mario.
author: SupraDarky

text:
wouldn't that make the battle turn based?
That would kinda miss the point of a metroidvania,since metroidvanias are all about real time somewhat difficult combat and exploration.

author: Daniel Cardoso

text:
This is random, but I am relaying a message from someone on Twitch.

I propose that we discard the word Metroidvania, and instead use the word Metroidlike. 

Castlevania is just a type of game in the Metroid style of gameplay.  Just like games with random descending floors in a large dungeon are considered one of the main aspects of a Roguelike.  To say Metroidvania is a bit redundant.  In fact, one of the lead designers of Symphony of the Night plainly stated that SotN was trying to capture elements of Super Metroid.  Saying a word that might be equivalent to a game like Rogue with that naming style (Metroidvania) is like saying RogueDiablo, or Rogueblo...

So, just something to think about that I thought about passing along from someone else.
author: Linestar777

text: @Linestar777 I think Metroidvania is a more descriptive term for the genre though, as it implies the inclusion of RPG elements such as leveling/'stats'/equipment. Though I see how it could be argued that Metroidvania is a sub-set of "Metroidlike"  ;)
author: xSayPleasex

text: A new Paper Mario that kept with the RPG theme would be amazing.
author: Name

text: That's a neat idea. I would like to see a Paper Mario game like that.
author: Medal Melodies

text:
@xSayPleasex Many games that are being called Metroidvania don't have any RPG elements to the, however. So while I like the idea of your explanation sounds, it's unfortunately not how these terms work or at least not how they are used. Metroidvania IS in fact redundant.
However, there have also been Metroid style games before Metroid, so I'm not sure that calling them all Metroid-like would be better or "fairer" or whatever.

text: I liked the Metroidvania-esque style of Kirby and the Amazing Mirror, and Mega Man ZX was interesting. Incidentally, I'm in the middle of Order of Ecclesia right now.
